examples: It begins under the Tapeats Sandstone, a stratum laid down by the ancient tides of a shallow sea about 508 to 501 million years ago during the Cambrian.
In relative dating, you can get an approximate age range for a fossil from a stratum of rock, by finding other rocks with similar composition that you can date reliably.
That’s because Sprigg’s little jelly-looking-things were found in a stratum of rock that was more than 550 million years old.
And when you’ve got a layer of rock that’s distinct from everything above and below it, that’s called a stratum.
words.defineEn: an abstract place usually conceived as having depth
words.defineVi: một nơi trừu tượng thường được hình thành như có chiều sâu

examples: And that led to a conundrum.

This year, researchers at Harvard and the Institute of Science and Technology Austria used evolutionary game theory to make sense of these conundrums.
words.defineEn: a problem or question that is confusing and needs a lot of skill or effort to solve or answer
words.defineVi: một vấn đề hoặc câu hỏi khó hiểu và cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để giải quyết hoặc trả lời

examples: If you sign the addendum and you're there, you're in the sequel.

examples: Each bacterium can create a copy of itself every 20 minutes.

examples: In Veneta, Oregon, Annie Molnar gave me a tour of The Emporium, a brand-new marketplace for local artisans.
